text: An election to South Tipperary County Council took place on 11 June 2004 as part of that year's Irish local elections. 26 councillors were elected from five electoral divisions by PR-STV voting for a five-year term of office. ==Results by party== {| class=wikitable ! colspan=2 align=center|Party ! valign=top|Seats ! valign=top|± ! valign=top|First Pref. votes ! valign=top|FPv% ! valign=top|±% |- | align=right|10 | align=right|-2 | align=right|14,561 | align=right|34.86% | align=right| |- | align=right|8 | align=right|-1 | align=right|11,641 | align=right|27.87% | align=right| |- | align=right|2 | align=right|+1 | align=right|4,000 | align=right|9.58% | align=right| |- | align=right|6 | align=right|+2 | align=right|8,751 | align=right|20.95% | align=right| |- | colspan=2 align=center|Totals | align=right |26 | align=center|- | align=right |41,770 | align=center|100% | align=center|— |} ==Results by Electoral Area== ===Cahir=== ===Cashel=== ===Clonmel=== ===Fethard=== ===Tipperary=== ==External links== Category:2004 Irish local elections 2004
title: 2004 South Tipperary County Council election
